  • Method Details

    • handling_lists_ByLanguages

      public List<ItemForXML> handling_lists_ByLanguages(List<ItemForXML> list_WithALanguage, String language)
      Sorting an array by languages priorities. Note: I think I'd prefer to get audios firstly from a English Native than a Spanish one.
      Parameters:
      list_WithALanguage - this list is found in "Searching_insideXMLFile.class"
      Returns:
      it returns a List with every language orderly.

    • handling_lists_ByCountry

      public List<ItemForXML> handling_lists_ByCountry(List<ItemForXML> list_WithACountry, String countryPriority)
      Sorting an array by country priorities. Example: Argentina (as parameter sent by a user) This method will add every "close countries" that "argentina" contains in the class "UserRequestVariables.class"
      Parameters:
      list_WithACountry - this list is found in "Searching_insideXMLFile.class"
      countryPriority - what country (and its close countries) will have the priority in the array. Note: this param has to be a pretty name
      Returns:
      it returns a List with every close country that a country contains orderly.

    • handling_lists_BySex

      public List<ItemForXML> handling_lists_BySex(List<ItemForXML> list_WithASex, String sex)
      Sorting an array by sex voice priorities. Note: I'd prefer to get audios from a girl instead of from a boy
      Parameters:
      list_WithASex - this list is found in "Searching_insideXMLFile.class"
      Returns:
      it returns a List with every sex orderly.

    • handling_lists_ByDate_year

      public List<ItemForXML> handling_lists_ByDate_year(List<ItemForXML> list_WithADate_year)
      Sorting an array by date (year) priorities. Note: I'd prefer the most updated ones
      Parameters:
      list_WithADate_year - this list is found in "Searching_insideXMLFile.class"
      Returns:
      it returns a List with every year (4 digits) orderly.

    • handling_lists_ByRate

      public List<ItemForXML> handling_lists_ByRate(List<ItemForXML> list_WithARate)
      Sorting an array by rate priorities. Note: I'd prefer the most rated ones. (from highest to lowest)
      Parameters:
      list_WithARate - this list is found in "Searching_insideXMLFile.class"
      Returns:
      it returns a List with every rate orderly.
